intro: Chrysanthemum pectinatum, commonly known as the woolly chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, white or grayish fuzzy foliage and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and prefers cool, temperate climates. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its unique appearance and is also used in traditional medicine. Chrysanthemum pectinatum is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
